title: What is AWS X-Ray used for?
explanation: AWS X-Ray is a distributed tracing service for analyzing application request flows.

title: What does AWS X-Ray primarily collect?
options: Trace data with metadata about downstream interactions
explanation: X-Ray collects trace data that includes metadata about downstream services and resources.

title: How do applications typically send trace data to X-Ray?
options: Via SDKs to a local X-Ray daemon
explanation: Applications use X-Ray SDKs to send trace data to a local daemon.

title: What is the main role of the X-Ray daemon?
explanation: The X-Ray daemon batches trace segments and uploads them to the X-Ray API.

title: What does an X-Ray segment represent?
options: A request handled by a service
A single line of application logs
explanation: Segments represent requests handled by individual services.

title: What are subsegments used for in X-Ray?
options: Capturing downstream calls and internal operations
explanation: Subsegments provide visibility into downstream calls and internal work.

title: Which feature controls how many requests are traced in X-Ray?
explanation: Sampling rules control the number of requests traced to manage overhead.

title: How is trace context propagated across services in X-Ray?
explanation: Trace IDs propagate through trace headers.

title: How long does AWS X-Ray retain trace data?
explanation: X-Ray retains trace and service graph data for 30 days.

title: Which protocol does the X-Ray daemon listen on?
explanation: The X-Ray daemon listens for UDP traffic from SDKs.

title: Which AWS service integrates with X-Ray without requiring a daemon?
explanation: AWS Lambda has native X-Ray integration.

title: What does the X-Ray service graph visualize?
explanation: The service graph shows how services interact and where latency occurs.

title: Which type of data is indexed for searching traces in X-Ray?
explanation: Annotations are indexed key-value pairs used for filtering traces.

title: What can metadata store in X-Ray?
explanation: Metadata stores arbitrary, non-indexed data.

title: Which instrumentation method requires inserting trace code manually in X-Ray?
explanation: Manual instrumentation requires explicitly adding tracing code.

title: What is AWS Distro for OpenTelemetry (ADOT)?
explanation: ADOT provides open standards-based telemetry with multiple backends.

title: Which approach requires no code changes in X-Ray?
explanation: Auto instrumentation captures trace data without modifying code.

title: Which protocol is used by the X-Ray daemon to receive data?
explanation: The daemon receives trace data over UDP.

title: Which SDK enables tracing in Node.js applications in X-Ray?
explanation: The X-Ray SDK for Node.js enables tracing in Node applications.

title: What does sampling help control in X-Ray?
explanation: Sampling reduces overhead and cost by limiting traced requests.

title: Which interface provides advanced monitoring alongside X-Ray?
explanation: CloudWatch integrates with X-Ray for advanced monitoring.

title: What propagates trace continuity across service boundaries in X-Ray?
explanation: Trace IDs propagated via headers maintain trace continuity.

title: What storage duration applies to X-Ray trace data?
explanation: X-Ray stores trace data for 30 days.

title: Which SDK supports tracing for Go applications in X-Ray?
explanation: The X-Ray SDK for Go enables tracing in Go applications.

title: Which AWS service can deploy the X-Ray daemon automatically?
explanation: Elastic Beanstalk can deploy the X-Ray daemon automatically.

title: Which SDK supports tracing in Java web applications in X-Ray?
explanation: The X-Ray SDK for Java supports tracing in Java web applications.

title: Which data type can be searched using filter expressions in X-Ray?
explanation: Filter expressions operate on indexed annotations.

title: Which SDK supports tracing for .NET applications in X-Ray?
explanation: The X-Ray SDK for .NET enables tracing in .NET applications.

title: What is AWS adopting as its primary observability standard in X-Ray?
explanation: AWS is adopting OpenTelemetry as its primary observability standard.

title: Which tool helps define X-Ray resources declaratively?
explanation: CloudFormation enables declarative provisioning of X-Ray resources.

title: What type of database is Amazon Neptune?
explanation: Amazon Neptune is a fully managed graph database optimized for connected data.

title: Which query language is supported by Neptune for RDF graphs?
explanation: Neptune supports SPARQL for querying RDF graphs.

title: What data model element represents relationships in a Neptune property graph?
explanation: Relationships in property graphs are represented as edges.

title: Which Neptune feature automatically scales capacity for unpredictable workloads?
explanation: Neptune Serverless automatically adjusts capacity based on workload demand.

title: What is the primary benefit of Neptune global databases?
explanation: Neptune global databases provide fast, low-latency reads across regions.

title: What component defines the relationship or property type in a Neptune quad?
explanation: The predicate defines the relationship or property type in a quad.

title: Which storage technology backs Neptune’s lookup cache?
explanation: Neptune’s lookup cache uses NVMe-based SSDs for fast access.

title: What can increased memory pressure in Neptune lead to?
explanation: When cache or memory is pressured, data may be fetched from slower cluster storage.

title: What transaction model does Amazon Neptune enforce?
explanation: Neptune enforces ACID-compliant transaction semantics.

title: Which endpoint handles write operations in a Neptune cluster?
explanation: Cluster endpoints handle all write operations with automatic failover.

title: Which Neptune endpoint uses DNS round-robin to distribute reads?
explanation: Reader endpoints distribute read traffic using DNS round-robin.

title: What does the Neptune DFE query engine optimize?
explanation: The DFE engine optimizes CPU, memory, and I/O resource usage.

title: Which query plan types can the Neptune DFE engine select?
explanation: The DFE engine selects left-deep, bushy, or hybrid query plans.

title: What is not guaranteed when Neptune uses internal compute parallelism?
explanation: Result ordering is not guaranteed with internal compute parallelism.

title: Which Java version is required for the Neptune JDBC driver?
explanation: The Neptune JDBC driver requires Java 8 or newer.

title: Where is graph data staged before bulk loading into Neptune?
explanation: Graph data is staged in Amazon S3 before using the Neptune Bulk Loader.

title: Which loading method is best for large datasets?
explanation: Bulk loading is optimized for large datasets.

title: Which file format can Neptune load using supported query languages?
explanation: Neptune supports formats like GraphML and GraphSON.

title: When does Neptune dictionary garbage collection run?
explanation: Dictionary GC runs only when Neptune Streams are inactive.

title: What is the benefit of inline server-generated edge IDs?
explanation: Inline edge IDs bypass the dictionary to improve storage efficiency.

title: What type of tools integrate with Neptune for graph visualization?
explanation: Neptune integrates with partner and third-party graph visualization tools.

title: Which protocol can be used to export RDF data from Neptune?
explanation: The Graph Store Protocol can be used to export RDF data.

title: What does Neptune Streams provide?
explanation: Neptune Streams provides a durable, ordered change-log of graph updates.

title: What happens when Neptune Streams are disabled?
explanation: Stream data cannot be accessed once streams are disabled.

title: Which service enables full-text search integration with Neptune?
explanation: Neptune integrates with Amazon OpenSearch Service for full-text search.

title: What is a best practice for using Neptune with AWS Lambda?
options: Open a new connection per query
Maintain a single connection per execution context
explanation: Maintaining a single connection per execution context avoids resource leaks.

title: What does Neptune ML use to extract hidden correlations?
explanation: Neptune ML uses GNNs and knowledge-graph embeddings.

title: Which AWS service underpins Neptune ML model training?
explanation: Neptune ML leverages Amazon SageMaker for training and deployment.

title: What is the maximum retention period for automated Neptune backups?
explanation: Automated backups can be retained for up to 35 days.

title: What happens to manual snapshots when a Neptune cluster is deleted?
options: They are converted to automated backups
explanation: Manual snapshots are retained even after cluster deletion.

title: What does ElastiCache Serverless abstract away from users?
explanation: ElastiCache Serverless automatically manages provisioning, scaling, monitoring, and capacity planning.

title: Which engines are supported by Amazon ElastiCache?
explanation: ElastiCache supports Valkey, Redis OSS, and Memcached.

title: What is a key advantage of node-based ElastiCache clusters?
options: Granular control over nodes and configuration
explanation: Node-based clusters provide fine-grained control over node types, scaling, and configuration.

title: How are serverless ElastiCache compute operations billed?
explanation: Serverless caches are billed using ECPUs for operations.

title: Which IAM mechanism can be used to grant permissions to ElastiCache?
explanation: IAM Identity Center permission sets, roles, or policies can grant ElastiCache permissions.

title: Where should an EC2 client be placed to access an ElastiCache cluster?
options: In the same VPC and security group
Outside the VPC using public IPs
In a different availability zone only
explanation: Clients must typically reside in the same VPC and security group.

title: What status indicates a new serverless cache is ready for use?
explanation: A serverless cache becomes usable when its status is ACTIVE.

title: What is an ElastiCache node?
explanation: Each node is a fixed-size, network-attached RAM instance.

title: Which mechanism controls configuration and behavior of ElastiCache engines?
explanation: Parameter groups manage engine configuration settings.

title: How does the ElastiCache API distinguish Redis OSS deployments?
explanation: The API/CLI distinguishes single-node clusters and replication groups.

title: What do ElastiCache node statuses indicate?
explanation: Node statuses reflect health and operational conditions.

title: Which tool can be used to check ElastiCache node status?
explanation: Node status can be checked via the console, CLI, or API.

title: What uniquely identifies an ElastiCache cluster in a Region?
explanation: Clusters are uniquely identified by a customer-provided cluster identifier.

title: What does Redis OSS cluster mode enable?
explanation: Cluster mode enables horizontal sharding across multiple shards.

title: How does Memcached scale in ElastiCache?
explanation: Memcached horizontally partitions data across nodes.

title: When must IPv4/IPv6 networking be configured for ElastiCache?
explanation: IP configuration must be set during cluster creation.

title: What do TLS-enabled ElastiCache clusters advertise to clients?
explanation: TLS-enabled clusters advertise hostnames rather than IPs.

title: Which practice improves ElastiCache performance?
explanation: Long-lived connections reduce connection overhead.

title: Why are read replicas useful in ElastiCache?
explanation: Read replicas distribute read workloads and improve scalability.

title: What consistency options do ElastiCache Serverless endpoints provide?
explanation: Different endpoints provide immediate or eventual consistency.

title: Which metrics drive ElastiCache Serverless autoscaling?
explanation: Autoscaling tracks CPU, memory, and network utilization.

title: What does pre-scaling (pre-warming) do in ElastiCache Serverless?
options: Reserves minimum compute or storage ahead of demand
explanation: Pre-scaling reserves minimum capacity for anticipated traffic spikes.

title: What is a Bloom filter in ElastiCache?
explanation: Bloom filters are space-efficient probabilistic data structures.

title: What guarantee do Bloom filters provide?
explanation: Bloom filters guarantee no false negatives but allow false positives.

title: What does the WATCH command support in ElastiCache?
explanation: WATCH enables optimistic concurrency control by monitoring keys.

title: What restriction applies to WATCH in ElastiCache Serverless?
options: Transactions must stay within one hash slot
explanation: WATCH transactions are limited to a single hash slot per connection.

title: What does ElastiCache support for vector search?
explanation: ElastiCache supports vector embeddings with specialized indexes.

title: Which algorithm provides approximate vector search in ElastiCache?
explanation: HNSW provides approximate vector search with tunable parameters.

title: What data format does ElastiCache natively support for schemaless storage?
explanation: ElastiCache natively supports schemaless JSON storage.

title: What is the primary purpose of DevOps Guru?
explanation: DevOps Guru uses machine learning to detect abnormal operational patterns.

title: What type of insights does DevOps Guru generate?
explanation: DevOps Guru generates both reactive and proactive insights.

title: What must be defined when enabling DevOps Guru?
options: Which AWS resources DevOps Guru monitors
explanation: You define the resources DevOps Guru analyzes via a coverage boundary.

title: Which data sources does DevOps Guru analyze?
explanation: DevOps Guru analyzes metrics, logs, and events.

title: What can DevOps Guru do when an insight is generated?
explanation: Insights can trigger notifications and optional OpsItems.

title: Which AWS service can receive OpsItems from DevOps Guru?
explanation: DevOps Guru integrates with Systems Manager OpsItems.

title: How are DevOps Guru insights categorized?
explanation: Insights are classified as reactive or proactive.

title: Which AWS service provides metrics analyzed by DevOps Guru?
explanation: DevOps Guru uses CloudWatch metrics.

title: What controls access to DevOps Guru data?
explanation: Access is controlled through IAM policies.

title: What coverage options can DevOps Guru use?
explanation: Coverage boundaries define which resources are analyzed.

title: What happens if no coverage boundary is specified in DevOps Guru?
explanation: DevOps Guru analyzes all supported resources by default.

title: Which databases are analyzed by DevOps Guru?
explanation: DevOps Guru analyzes relational databases like RDS and Redshift.

title: What additional data does DevOps Guru analyze for supported RDS engines?
explanation: Performance Insights data is used to detect anomalies.

title: Which issues can DevOps Guru detect in databases?
explanation: DevOps Guru detects contention, missing indexes, and misconfigurations.

title: Which NoSQL service is analyzed by DevOps Guru?
explanation: DevOps Guru analyzes DynamoDB capacity, throttling, and transaction failures.

title: Which service enables DevOps Guru event automation?
explanation: DevOps Guru integrates with EventBridge.

title: What IAM action allows DevOps Guru to list monitored resources?
explanation: DevOps Guru relies on ListMonitoredResources.

title: How can DevOps Guru costs be controlled?
explanation: Resource analysis can be disabled per account or Region.

title: What may still incur charges after disabling DevOps Guru analysis?
options: API access to existing DevOps Guru insights
explanation: Accessing previously generated insights via API calls can still incur minor charges.

title: How does DevOps Guru group analyzed resources?
explanation: DevOps Guru groups resources into applications within a coverage boundary.

title: Which feature enables DevOps Guru OpsItem creation?
explanation: OpsItems are created through Systems Manager integration.

title: Which types of AWS resources can DevOps Guru analyze within its coverage boundary?
options: Supported AWS resources (for example compute, databases, and storage)
explanation: DevOps Guru analyzes supported AWS resources within the configured coverage boundary.

title: What happens if DevOps Guru ListMonitoredResources is denied?
options: DevOps Guru can’t list resources, so analysis/visibility is blocked
explanation: DevOps Guru uses ListMonitoredResources for grouping/analysis; denying it blocks visibility.

title: What encryption option does DevOps Guru support?
explanation: DevOps Guru supports encryption using AWS KMS keys.

title: Which AWS service delivers DevOps Guru notifications?
explanation: DevOps Guru publishes notifications to SNS topics.

title: What kind of analysis approach does DevOps Guru use to detect anomalies?
explanation: DevOps Guru uses ML to detect abnormal patterns beyond static thresholds.

title: What is required to receive DevOps Guru insight notifications?
options: An SNS topic that DevOps Guru can publish to
explanation: You configure an SNS topic for DevOps Guru notifications with the right publish permissions.

title: What is a proactive insight in DevOps Guru?
options: An insight that predicts issues before they occur
An insight that only reports resolved issues
An insight that shows historical logs only
explanation: Proactive insights predict issues before they happen.

title: What does disabling DevOps Guru resource analysis prevent?
options: New insight generation for resources (analysis stops)
explanation: Disabling analysis stops new insights from being generated for resources.

title: Which IAM action is key for DevOps Guru to have visibility into monitored resources?
explanation: DevOps Guru visibility/grouping depends on permission for ListMonitoredResources.

title: What is the primary purpose of AWS CloudFormation?
options: Define and manage AWS resources declaratively
explanation: CloudFormation lets you define, provision, and manage AWS resources using declarative templates.

title: Which formats are supported for AWS CloudFormation templates?
explanation: CloudFormation templates are written in JSON or YAML.

title: Which section is required in every AWS CloudFormation template?
explanation: The Resources section is the only required section in a CloudFormation template.

title: What does AWS CloudFormation create when you deploy a template?
explanation: Deploying a template creates a CloudFormation stack.

title: Where can AWS CloudFormation templates be stored?
options: Amazon S3 or a Git repository
explanation: Templates can be stored in S3 or source-controlled repositories.

title: Which AWS CloudFormation feature previews changes before applying them?
explanation: Change sets show what changes will be made before an update.

title: Which tools can be used to manage AWS CloudFormation stacks?
options: Console, CLI, SDKs, API, PowerShell, and CDK
explanation: CloudFormation stacks can be managed through multiple AWS tools.

title: What problem do AWS CloudFormation StackSets solve?
explanation: StackSets deploy stacks across multiple accounts and Regions.

title: Which account manages deployments when using CloudFormation StackSets?
explanation: An administrator account manages StackSet deployments.

title: What do CloudFormation StackSet operation status codes indicate?
explanation: Status codes show progress or issues at StackSet and instance levels.

title: What is AWS CloudFormation Git sync used for?
explanation: Git sync connects CloudFormation to a Git repo to manage stacks.

title: Which AWS service enables CloudFormation Git sync connections?
explanation: CloudFormation Git sync uses CodeConnections.

title: What happens when CloudFormation Git sync detects changes?
options: Pull requests are generated for review
explanation: Git sync generates pull requests before updating stacks.

title: What is the purpose of the AWS CloudFormation registry?
options: Manage extensions like Hooks, Modules, and resource types
explanation: The registry manages CloudFormation extensions.

title: Which CloudFormation extension enforces compliance during stack operations?
explanation: Hooks validate and enforce compliance rules.

title: Which CloudFormation extension enables reusable configurations?
explanation: Modules package reusable CloudFormation logic.

title: Which CloudFormation registry extensions may require activation?
explanation: Third-party public extensions must be activated.

title: What is the first stage in a CloudFormation CodePipeline workflow?
explanation: The pipeline first retrieves templates from S3.

title: What happens after the test stack is approved in a CloudFormation pipeline?
options: It is converted to a StackSet
explanation: The test stack is deleted after approval.

title: What is generated before updating the production stack in CloudFormation pipelines?
explanation: A change set is created before applying production changes.

title: Which AWS service provides predefined event patterns for CloudFormation events?
explanation: EventBridge provides predefined CloudFormation event patterns.

title: What does an EventBridge rule evaluate for CloudFormation events?
options: Event attributes like source and detail-type
explanation: EventBridge evaluates event attributes to match rules.

title: Which CloudFormation feature helps track infrastructure configuration changes?
explanation: Versioned templates allow tracking configuration changes.

title: What happens if a CloudFormation stack update fails?
explanation: CloudFormation automatically rolls back failed updates.

title: Which CloudFormation capability allows visual template creation?
explanation: CloudFormation Designer provides a visual template editor.

title: What must be enabled for CloudFormation pipelines using S3 artifacts?
explanation: S3 versioning is required for pipeline artifacts.

title: Which CloudFormation feature supports enforcing least privilege changes?
explanation: Hooks can enforce best practices and compliance.

title: What role do tags play in CloudFormation StackSets?
explanation: Tags help with cost management and resource organization.

title: Which CloudFormation feature monitors template changes in Git?
explanation: Git sync monitors repositories for template changes.

title: What is a key benefit of AWS CloudFormation for infrastructure management?
explanation: CloudFormation enables consistent and repeatable infrastructure deployments.

title: What type of resources can AWS Access Analyzer evaluate for external sharing?
options: Multiple resource types including IAM roles and S3 buckets
explanation: Access Analyzer evaluates resources such as IAM roles, S3 buckets, KMS keys, Lambda functions, and SQS queues.

title: Which AWS CLI command is used to retrieve primary account contact information?
explanation: The get-contact-information command retrieves account contact details.

title: What is the primary purpose of AWS Certificate Manager?
explanation: ACM provisions, manages, and deploys SSL/TLS certificates.

title: Which ACM feature supports internal-only certificate issuance?
explanation: ACM Private CA issues private certificates for internal use.

title: Which command issues a private certificate using ACM PCA?
explanation: The issue-certificate command issues a certificate from a private CA.

title: Which AWS service uses ML to detect operational anomalies?
explanation: DevOps Guru applies machine learning to detect abnormal operational behavior.

title: What data source provides metrics for DevOps Guru analysis?
explanation: DevOps Guru consumes metrics from Amazon CloudWatch.

title: Which service receives OpsItems created by DevOps Guru?
explanation: DevOps Guru creates OpsItems in AWS Systems Manager.

title: What happens when DevOps Guru resource analysis is disabled?
explanation: Disabling analysis stops new insight generation.

title: Which IAM permission is required for DevOps Guru resource visibility?
explanation: ListMonitoredResources enables DevOps Guru to see and group resources.

title: What is the required section in every CloudFormation template?
explanation: Resources is the only mandatory section in a CloudFormation template.

title: Which file formats are valid for CloudFormation templates?
explanation: CloudFormation templates support YAML and JSON.

title: What does CloudFormation create when a template is deployed?
explanation: Deploying a template results in a CloudFormation stack.

title: Which CloudFormation feature previews changes before execution?
explanation: Change sets show proposed changes before applying them.

title: What problem do CloudFormation StackSets primarily solve?
explanation: StackSets deploy stacks across multiple accounts and Regions.

title: Which account controls StackSet deployments?
explanation: The administrator account manages StackSet operations.

title: What is CloudFormation Git sync used for?
explanation: Git sync links CloudFormation stacks to Git repositories.

title: Which service enables CloudFormation Git sync connections?
explanation: CloudFormation Git sync relies on AWS CodeConnections.

title: Which CloudFormation registry extension enforces compliance?
explanation: Hooks enforce compliance during stack operations.

title: What occurs when a CloudFormation stack update fails?
explanation: CloudFormation automatically rolls back failed updates.

title: Which tool provides a visual editor for CloudFormation templates?
explanation: CloudFormation Designer offers a visual template editor.

title: What must be enabled on S3 buckets used for CloudFormation pipelines?
explanation: S3 versioning is required for pipeline artifacts.

title: Which CloudFormation feature helps enforce least-privilege changes?
explanation: Hooks can enforce compliance and least-privilege rules.

title: Which service delivers CloudFormation events to rules-based targets?
explanation: EventBridge processes CloudFormation events using event patterns.

title: What does EventBridge evaluate to match CloudFormation events?
explanation: EventBridge evaluates attributes such as source and detail-type.

title: Which feature helps track infrastructure changes over time?
explanation: Versioned templates help track configuration changes.

title: What is a primary benefit of CloudFormation?
explanation: CloudFormation ensures consistent and repeatable deployments.

title: Which AWS service manages Prometheus workspaces?
explanation: Amazon Managed Prometheus manages Prometheus workspaces.

title: Which command sets a friendly name for a Prometheus workspace?
explanation: update-workspace-alias assigns a human-friendly name.

title: Which service is used to deploy full-stack web applications?
explanation: AWS Amplify deploys and manages full-stack web and mobile apps.

title: Which Amplify command creates a new application?
explanation: amplify create-app creates a new Amplify application.

title: What does Amplify Backend Environments manage?
explanation: Amplify backend environments manage backend resources.

title: Which service allows programmatic management of Amplify UI components?
explanation: amplifyuibuilder manages UI components and themes.

title: Which service manages application configuration independently of code?
explanation: AWS AppConfig manages application configuration data.

title: Which AppConfig command starts a configuration deployment?
explanation: start-deployment initiates a configuration rollout.

title: Which AppConfig data command retrieves the latest configuration?
explanation: get-latest-configuration retrieves runtime config data.

title: What is a key benefit of using AWS AppConfig?
options: Dynamic configuration updates without redeploying apps
explanation: AppConfig allows configuration changes without redeployment.

title: Which service enables controlled rollout and rollback of configuration changes?
explanation: AWS AppConfig supports controlled deployments and rollbacks.

title: What is the primary function of AWS AppFabric?
options: Centralize and normalize SaaS application data
explanation: AppFabric standardizes and centralizes data from SaaS applications for security and analytics.

title: Which AppFabric command lists available app bundles?
explanation: list-app-bundles returns metadata for AppFabric app bundles.

title: What is the purpose of create-app-authorization in AppFabric?
explanation: App authorizations allow AppFabric to integrate with SaaS services.

title: Which AppFabric command retrieves user-related access tasks?
explanation: batch-get-user-access-tasks queries access tasks across SaaS apps.

title: Which AWS service is used to orchestrate data transfers between AWS and SaaS applications?
explanation: AppFlow manages and automates secure data flows with SaaS providers.

title: Which AppFlow command initiates execution of a flow?
explanation: start-flow runs an existing AppFlow flow.

title: Which AppFlow command removes a data flow?
explanation: delete-flow permanently removes an AppFlow flow.

title: What capability does AWS AppIntegrations provide?
options: Event and data integration with SaaS apps
explanation: AppIntegrations manages data and event integrations with external SaaS applications.

title: Which AppIntegrations command creates a new data integration?
explanation: create-data-integration defines a new data integration resource.

title: Which service manages automatic scaling across multiple AWS services?
explanation: The application-autoscaling service manages scalable targets and policies.

title: Which command registers a resource as a scalable target?
explanation: register-scalable-target enables scaling for a supported resource.

title: Which command removes a scaling policy?
explanation: delete-scaling-policy deletes an existing scaling policy.

title: What is the purpose of AWS Application Insights?
options: Monitor application health and detect issues
explanation: Application Insights provides monitoring and automated problem detection.

title: Which Application Insights command creates a monitored application?
explanation: create-application defines an application for monitoring.

title: Which service collects telemetry such as traces and metrics for application performance?
explanation: Application Signals provides deep visibility using telemetry data.

title: Which Application Signals command lists monitored environments?
explanation: list-environments retrieves monitored environments.

title: What is the purpose of applicationcostprofiler?
options: Allocate and analyze application cost data
explanation: Application Cost Profiler analyzes application cost and usage data.

title: Which applicationcostprofiler command defines a cost report?
explanation: put-report-definition defines profiling reports.

title: Which AWS service provides a managed service mesh?
explanation: App Mesh manages service-to-service communication in microservices.

title: Which App Mesh resource represents a logical service?
explanation: Virtual services define logical services within a mesh.

title: Which AWS service deploys web apps directly from source code or container images?
explanation: App Runner builds and deploys applications without infrastructure management.

title: Which App Runner command creates a new service?
explanation: create-service provisions an App Runner service.

title: What is AWS AppStream primarily used for?
explanation: AppStream streams desktop applications securely to users.

title: Which AppStream resource defines the user environment?
explanation: Stacks define user access and application settings.

title: Which AWS service manages GraphQL APIs?
explanation: AppSync is used to build and manage GraphQL APIs.

title: Which AppSync component connects APIs to backend data sources?
explanation: Resolvers map GraphQL fields to backend data sources.

title: What does arc-region-switch enable?
options: Changing active regions for ARC resources
explanation: arc-region-switch updates the active region for ARC-managed resources.

title: Which service shifts traffic away from an impaired Availability Zone?
explanation: arc-zonal-shift redirects traffic away from unhealthy zones.

title: What is the primary purpose of AWS CodeArtifact?
explanation: CodeArtifact manages package repositories for software dependencies.

title: Which CodeArtifact command retrieves an authorization token?
explanation: get-authorization-token is used for repository authentication.

title: What is Amazon Athena primarily used for?
options: Query data in Amazon S3 using SQL
explanation: Athena is a serverless query service that analyzes data stored in S3 using standard SQL.

title: Which Athena command submits a SQL query for execution?
explanation: start-query-execution submits a SQL statement to Athena.

title: What is the purpose of an Athena workgroup?
explanation: Workgroups help manage query execution settings, access, and cost controls.

title: Which service automates evidence collection for compliance audits?
explanation: Audit Manager automates evidence collection and compliance reporting.

title: Which Audit Manager command creates a new assessment?
explanation: create-assessment initializes a new compliance assessment.

title: Which compliance frameworks can AWS Audit Manager support?
options: Frameworks such as CIS, GDPR, and ISO 27001
explanation: Audit Manager supports multiple industry compliance frameworks.

title: What does Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling primarily manage?
options: Number of EC2 instances in a group
explanation: Auto Scaling adjusts EC2 instance counts based on demand.

title: Which command creates a new Auto Scaling group?
explanation: create-auto-scaling-group defines a new EC2 Auto Scaling group.

title: Which event can trigger an Auto Scaling policy?
explanation: Scaling policies can be driven by metrics or schedules.

title: What is the purpose of autoscaling-plans?
explanation: Scaling plans orchestrate scaling for multiple AWS services.

title: Which autoscaling-plans command creates a new scaling plan?
explanation: create-scaling-plan defines a new scaling plan.

title: What type of scaling does autoscaling-plans support?
explanation: Autoscaling plans support both target tracking and predictive scaling.

title: What is AWS B2BI primarily used for?
explanation: AWS B2BI enables secure exchange of EDI/XML documents between partners.

title: Which B2BI command defines a trading partner?
explanation: create-partner registers a trading partner.

title: Which AWS service centrally manages backups across AWS services?
explanation: AWS Backup centrally automates and manages backups.

title: Which AWS Backup command starts an on-demand backup?

title: What is the role of AWS Backup Gateway?

title: Which service manages regional WAF resources for ALB and API Gateway?
explanation: waf-regional is used for region-specific WAF configurations.

title: Which WAFv2 command associates a WebACL with a resource?
explanation: associate-web-acl attaches a WebACL to a supported AWS resource.

title: Which service helps review workloads against AWS best practices?
explanation: AWS Well-Architected Tool evaluates workloads using AWS best-practice pillars.

title: Which Well-Architected command creates a workload?
explanation: create-workload defines a new workload for assessment.

title: Which service surfaces knowledge articles for contact center agents?
explanation: AWS Wisdom provides contextual knowledge recommendations to agents.

title: Which AWS Wisdom command searches content in a knowledge base?
explanation: search-content retrieves relevant articles from Wisdom knowledge bases.

title: Which service provides secure document storage and collaboration?
explanation: Amazon WorkDocs enables secure file storage, sharing, and collaboration.

title: Which WorkDocs command lists users?
explanation: describe-users retrieves user accounts in WorkDocs.

title: Which service manages enterprise email with mailboxes and users?
explanation: Amazon WorkMail provides managed enterprise email services.

title: Which WorkMail command creates a new organization?
explanation: create-organization provisions a new WorkMail organization.

title: Which service allows access to raw WorkMail message content?
explanation: workmailmessageflow provides access to raw email message content.

title: Which service provides cloud-based virtual desktops?
explanation: Amazon WorkSpaces delivers managed virtual desktop infrastructure.

title: Which WorkSpaces command provisions new desktops?
explanation: create-workspaces launches new WorkSpaces for users.

title: Which service manages hardware thin clients for WorkSpaces?
explanation: workspaces-thin-client manages WorkSpaces Thin Client devices.

title: Which service provides secure browser-based access to internal web apps?
explanation: workspaces-web delivers secure, browser-based application access.

title: Which service traces distributed application requests?
explanation: AWS X-Ray traces and analyzes distributed application requests.

title: Which X-Ray command retrieves trace data?
explanation: batch-get-traces retrieves detailed trace documents.

title: Which X-Ray command visualizes service dependencies?
explanation: get-service-graph shows relationships and latency between services.
